A poker term
A card in your hand that is higher than the highest card on the board
Example: holding an Ace when the board is King, Jack, 7
A poker term
The highest unmatched card in a hand
Example: holding Ace, King with a pair of Queens on the board
A poker term
Two cards of the same rank dealt as hole cards
Example: two Aces
The two cards dealt to a player in Texas Hold'em
Only the player can see them
Also known as 'pocket cards'
The community cards in a poker game
Shared by all players
Consists of the flop, turn, and river
Cards that are shared by all players
Dealt face up in the middle of the table
Also known as 'the board'
A card used to protect the bottom of the deck
Often a blank card or a card with a special design
Placed after the dealer has cut the deck
A device used to hold multiple decks of cards
Used in casino games like Blackjack and Baccarat
Helps to prevent cheating
